title: Why Nebraska football’s biggest issue is developing talent.
text:
No one can argue that the most important part of college football is the players. Good players, good football team, right? Well, for Nebraska fans unfortunately that may not be the case. Recruiting in football is almost as exciting to pay attention to as a game itself, the excitement to see which young prospect your team has secured over its competitors.
Nebraska simply put is not bad at recruiting, which for other schools in the Big Ten is a slight issue. The Huskers are an exciting team on paper each and every year, but once that fall season rolls around its nothing but sad faces in the sea of red.
Each year 24/7 Sports ranks prospects all around the nation and assigns them a corresponding star grade if they are worthy of it, the most common rankings are 3-5 stars. The more gifted the prospect the higher rating they are assigned.
This leads to, in theory, good football times right? Lets take a look at who’s been the most successful at recruiting graded talent over the last 10 years.


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggrepel)
library(ggbump)

standings <- read_csv("standings.csv")
recruits <- read_csv("RecruitingData.csv")
bigtenrank <- read_csv("rankingsbigten.csv")
combined <- read_csv("combinedrecstan.csv")

bigstandings <- standings |>
  filter(Conf == "Big Ten (East)" |
         Conf == "Big Ten (West)")
recruittotals <-recruits |>
  group_by(Team) |>
  summarise(
    TFStotalfives = sum(TFSFiveStars),
    TFStotalfours = sum(TFSFourStars),
    TFStotalthrees = sum(TFSThreeStars))
tfstotals <- recruittotals |>
  pivot_longer(
    cols=starts_with("TFS"),
    names_to="Type",
    values_to="Stars"
  )
ggplot() +
  geom_bar(data=tfstotals, aes(x=reorder(Team, Stars), weight=Stars, fill=Type)) +
  scale_fill_manual(
    values=c("gold", "darkblue", "darkred"),
    labels=c('Five Stars', 'Four Stars', 'Three Stars'))+
  labs(
    x="Teams",
    y="Total graded recruits",
    title="Nebraska attracts a shocking amount of recruits",
    subtitle="Nebraska finishes third within total graded recruits over the past 10 years
    without a single 5-star recruit",
    caption="Source: 24/7 Sports | By Austin Tejral"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  ) +
  coord_flip()









Now seeing teams like Ohio State and Michigan at the top should be no surprise as they have been some of the best teams in the Big Ten, but sneaking in right at the three spot Nebraska makes an appearance. Nebraska managed to pull in 224 graded recruits in the last ten years which is a bit of a surprise. Now recruiting only matters if they make an impact on the field, so let’s see how recruiting ranking matches up with where a team finished in the Big Ten at the end of the season.


Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_bump(data=bigtenrank, aes(x=Year, y=Rank, colour=Team)) +
  geom_point(data=bigtenrank, aes(x=Year, y=Rank, colour=Team)) +
  geom_text(data = bigtenrank |> filter(Year == min(Year)), aes(x = Year - .2, y=Rank, label = Team), size = 3, hjust = 1) +
  geom_text(data = bigtenrank |> filter(Year == max(Year)), aes(x = Year + .2, y=Rank, label = Team), size = 3, hjust = 0) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("#13294B", "#990000", "#FFCD00", "#E03A3E", "#00274C", "#18453B", "#7A0019", "lightgreen", "#4E2A84", "#BB0000", "#041E42", "#CEB888", "#CC0033", "#C5050C")) +
  labs(
    x="Year",
    y="Rank",
    title="Nebraska struggles to do well in the Big Ten",
    subtitle="They have failed to make a top-8 finish within the Big Ten since 2016",
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Austin Tejral"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    legend.position = "none",
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
  ) +
  scale_y_reverse()









To a lot of Husker fans that light green line should tell you nothing you haven’t suffered through already, Nebraska has stunk. Now you might be thinking if Nebraska has been this bad for this long then those recruiting numbers are probably skewed due to recruits coming during Nebraska’s top-6 finishes.
Oh how we all wish that was the case, lets take a look at 24/7 Sports’ recruiting rank over the last ten years.


Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_bump(data=recruits, aes(x=Year, y=TFSRank, colour=Team)) +
  geom_point(data=recruits, aes(x=Year, y=TFSRank, colour=Team)) +
  geom_text(data = recruits |> filter(Year == min(Year)), aes(x = Year - .2, y=TFSRank, label = Team), size = 3, hjust = 1) +
  geom_text(data = recruits |> filter(Year == max(Year)), aes(x = Year + .2, y=TFSRank, label = Team), size = 3, hjust = 0) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("#13294B", "#990000", "#FFCD00", "#E03A3E", "#00274C", "#18453B", "#7A0019", "lightgreen", "#4E2A84", "#BB0000", "#041E42", "#CEB888", "#CC0033", "#C5050C")) +
  labs(
    x="Year",
    y="Rank",
    title="The Huskers still manage to be a Top-5 recruiting school",
    subtitle="Shockingly even without any success in the Big Ten recently Nebraska managed to have a 
    Top-5 recruiting class 8 out of the last 10 years",
    caption="Source: 24/7 Sports | By Austin Tejral"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    legend.position = "none"
  ) +
  scale_y_reverse() +
  scale_x_continuous()









Shockingly Nebraska has managed to consistently pull in recruiting classes without ever showing results. This then brings to question do wins even lead to recruits, or do recruits even positively equate to wins.
One way to test this is to add up all of the star values over the last 10 years for each Big Ten School and plot them against total wins. Let’s take a look.


Code
nebcombined <- combined |>
  filter(Team == "Nebraska")
ggplot() +
  geom_point(data=combined, aes(x=TotalWins, y=TFSTotalStar)) +
  geom_point(data=nebcombined, aes(x=TotalWins, y=TFSTotalStar, colour="darkred")) +
  geom_text(aes(x=50, y=800, label="Lots of recruits, Low wins", colour="blue")) + 
  geom_text(aes(x=90, y=580, label="Low recruits, High wins", colour="blue")) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 69.5) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 680) +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=combined,
    aes(x=TotalWins, y=TFSTotalStar, label=Team) 
  ) +
  labs(
    x="Total Wins",
    y="Total Stars Value",
    title="The Huskers can't seem to either keep or develop their talent",
    subtitle="Nebraska stands alone as they finished high on overall star count, but below-average Sssin wins",
    caption="Source: 24/7 Sports and Sports Reference | By Austin Tejral"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    legend.position = "none"
  )









The heartbreaking truth is brought to light, Nebraska unfortunately stands all by itself in a terrible corner. Nebraska managed the fourth highest overall star count, but fails to translate these players into wins. Which the best recruiters in the Big Ten have done and done well.
This brings us to an unsettling reality, can the Huskers develop their talent in order to top the Big Ten, the data points to no. This however will not kill many Husker fans’ spirit as I, much like many others, will continue to drink the Kool-Aid and watch 2024’s 6th ranked draft class turn the Huskers into national champions once again.

title: Austin Tejral's Sport Data Blog
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(ggplot2)
library(ggrepel)
library(ggbump)


standings <- read_csv("standings.csv")

Rows: 1298 Columns: 18
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (3): School, Conf, Notes
dbl (15): Rk, Year, Wins, Losses, WinPct, ConfWins, ConfLosses, ConfWinPct, ...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

recruits <- read_csv("RecruitingData.csv")

Rows: 140 Columns: 10
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): Team
dbl (9): Year, TFSRank, TFSFiveStars, TFSFourStars, TFSThreeStars, ONTRank, ...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

bigtenrank <- read_csv("rankingsbigten.csv")

Rows: 140 Columns: 10
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (2): Team, Conference
dbl (8): Rank, Year, Wins, Losses, WinPct, ConfWins, ConfLosses, ConfWinPct

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

combined <- read_csv("combinedrecstan.csv")

Rows: 14 Columns: 4
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): Team
dbl (3): TotalWins, TFSTotalStar, ONTTotalStar

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.



bigstandings <- standings |>
  filter(Conf == "Big Ten (East)" |
         Conf == "Big Ten (West)")


recruittotals <-recruits |>
  group_by(Team) |>
  summarise(
    TFStotalfives = sum(TFSFiveStars),
    TFStotalfours = sum(TFSFourStars),
    TFStotalthrees = sum(TFSThreeStars),
    ONTtotalfives = sum(ONTFiveStars),
    ONTtotalfours = sum(ONTFourStars),
    ONTtotalthrees = sum(ONTThreeStars)
  ) 
view(recruittotals)


tfstotals <- recruittotals |>
  pivot_longer(
    cols=starts_with("TFS"),
    names_to="Type",
    values_to="Stars"
  )
onttotals <- recruittotals |>
  pivot_longer(
    cols=starts_with("ONT"),
    names_to="Type",
    values_to="Stars"
  )


ggplot() +
  geom_bar(data=tfstotals, aes(x=reorder(Team, Stars), weight=Stars, fill=Type)) +
  scale_fill_manual(
    values=c("gold", "darkblue", "darkred"),
    labels=c('Five Stars', 'Four Stars', 'Three Stars'))+
  labs(
    x="Teams",
    y="Total graded recruits",
    title="Nebraska attracts a shocking amount of recruits",
    subtitle="Nebraska finishes third within total graded recruits over the past 10 years
    without a single 5-star recruit",
    caption="Source: 24/7 Sports | By Austin Tejral"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  ) +
  coord_flip()









ggplot() +
  geom_bar(data=onttotals, aes(x=reorder(Team, Stars), weight=Stars, fill=Type)) +
  scale_fill_manual(
    values=c("gold", "darkblue", "darkred"),
    labels=c('Five Stars', 'Four Stars', 'Three Stars'))+
  labs(
    x="Teams",
    y="Total graded recruits",
    title="Ohio State is dominant in recruiting",
    subtitle="Over the last 10 year they have recruited 27 five-star players,
    more than the rest of the Big Ten combined",
    caption="Source: ON3 | By Austin Tejral"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  ) +
  coord_flip()









nebbigrank <- bigtenrank |>
  filter(Team == "Nebraska")
view(nebbigrank)


ggplot() + 
  geom_bump(data=bigtenrank, aes(x=Year, y=Rank, colour=Team)) +
  geom_point(data=bigtenrank, aes(x=Year, y=Rank, colour=Team)) +
  geom_text(data = bigtenrank |> filter(Year == min(Year)), aes(x = Year - .2, y=Rank, label = Team), size = 3, hjust = 1) +
  geom_text(data = bigtenrank |> filter(Year == max(Year)), aes(x = Year + .2, y=Rank, label = Team), size = 3, hjust = 0) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("#13294B", "#990000", "#FFCD00", "#E03A3E", "#00274C", "#18453B", "#7A0019", "lightgreen", "#4E2A84", "#BB0000", "#041E42", "#CEB888", "#CC0033", "#C5050C")) +
  labs(
    x="Year",
    y="Rank",
    title="Nebraska struggles to do well in the Big Ten",
    subtitle="They have failed to make a top-8 finish within the Big Ten since 2016",
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Austin Tejral"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    legend.position = "none",
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
  ) +
  scale_y_reverse()









ggplot() + 
  geom_bump(data=recruits, aes(x=Year, y=TFSRank, colour=Team)) +
  geom_point(data=recruits, aes(x=Year, y=TFSRank, colour=Team)) +
  geom_text(data = recruits |> filter(Year == min(Year)), aes(x = Year - .2, y=TFSRank, label = Team), size = 3, hjust = 1) +
  geom_text(data = recruits |> filter(Year == max(Year)), aes(x = Year + .2, y=TFSRank, label = Team), size = 3, hjust = 0) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("#13294B", "#990000", "#FFCD00", "#E03A3E", "#00274C", "#18453B", "#7A0019", "lightgreen", "#4E2A84", "#BB0000", "#041E42", "#CEB888", "#CC0033", "#C5050C")) +
  labs(
    x="Year",
    y="Rank",
    title="The Huskers still manage to be a Top-5 recruiting school",
    subtitle="Shockingly even without any success in the Big Ten recently Nebraska managed to have a 
    Top-5 recruiting class 8 out of the last 10 years",
    caption="Source: 24/7 Sports | By Austin Tejral"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    legend.position = "none"
  ) +
  scale_y_reverse() +
  scale_x_continuous()









ggplot() + 
  geom_bump(data=recruits, aes(x=Year, y=ONTRank, colour=Team)) +
  geom_point(data=recruits, aes(x=Year, y=ONTRank, colour=Team)) +
  geom_text(data = recruits |> filter(Year == min(Year)), aes(x = Year - .2, y=ONTRank, label = Team), size = 3, hjust = 1) +
  geom_text(data = recruits |> filter(Year == max(Year)), aes(x = Year + .2, y=ONTRank, label = Team), size = 3, hjust = 0) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("#13294B", "#990000", "#FFCD00", "#E03A3E", "#00274C", "#18453B", "#7A0019", "lightgreen", "#4E2A84", "#BB0000", "#041E42", "#CEB888", "#CC0033", "#C5050C")) +
  labs(
    x="Year",
    y="Rank",
    title="Ohio State is dominant in recruiting",
    subtitle="Over the last 10 year they have recruited 27 five-star players,
    more than the rest of the Big Ten combined",
    caption="Source: ON3 | By Austin Tejral"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    legend.position = "none"
  ) +
  scale_y_reverse() +
  scale_x_continuous()









starrecruits <- recruits |>
  group_by(Team) |>
  mutate(
    TFStotalfives = sum(TFSFiveStars),
    TFStotalfours = sum(TFSFourStars),
    TFStotalthrees = sum(TFSThreeStars),
    TFSthreestartotal = TFStotalthrees * 3,
    TFSfourstartotal = TFStotalfours * 4,
    TFSfivestartotal = TFStotalfives * 5,
    ONTtotalfives = sum(ONTFiveStars),
    ONTtotalfours = sum(ONTFourStars),
    ONTtotalthrees = sum(ONTThreeStars),
    ONTthreestartotal = ONTtotalthrees * 3,
    ONTfourstartotal = ONTtotalfours * 4,
    ONTfivestartotal = ONTtotalfives * 5,
  ) |>
  summarise(
    ONTtotalstar = ONTthreestartotal+ONTfourstartotal+ONTfivestartotal,
    TFStotalstar = TFSthreestartotal+TFSfourstartotal+TFSfivestartotal
  )

Warning: Returning more (or less) than 1 row per `summarise()` group was deprecated in
dplyr 1.1.0.
ℹ Please use `reframe()` instead.
ℹ When switching from `summarise()` to `reframe()`, remember that `reframe()`
  always returns an ungrouped data frame and adjust accordingly.


`summarise()` has grouped output by 'Team'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.

view(starrecruits)


totalws <- bigstandings |>
  group_by(School) |>
  summarize(
    totalwins = sum(Wins))


combined |>
  summarize(
    meanwins = mean(TotalWins),
    meanstarscore = mean(TFSTotalStar)
  )

# A tibble: 1 × 2
  meanwins meanstarscore
     <dbl>         <dbl>
1     69.4          680.



nebcombined <- combined |>
  filter(Team == "Nebraska")


ggplot() +
  geom_point(data=combined, aes(x=TotalWins, y=TFSTotalStar)) +
  geom_point(data=nebcombined, aes(x=TotalWins, y=TFSTotalStar, colour="darkred")) +
  geom_text(aes(x=50, y=800, label="Lots of recruits, Low wins", colour="blue")) + 
  geom_text(aes(x=90, y=580, label="Low recruits, High wins", colour="blue")) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 69.5) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 680) +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=combined,
    aes(x=TotalWins, y=TFSTotalStar, label=Team) 
  ) +
  labs(
    x="Total Wins",
    y="Total Stars Value",
    title="The Huskers can't seem to either keep or develop their talent",
    subtitle="Nebraska stands alone as they finished high on overall star count, but below-average Sssin wins",
    caption="Source: 24/7 Sports and Sports Reference | By Austin Tejral"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    legend.position = "none"
  )









ggplot() +
  geom_point(data=combined, aes(x=TotalWins, y=ONTTotalStar)) +
  labs(
    x="Teams",
    y="Total graded recruits",
    title="Ohio State is dominant in recruiting",
    subtitle="Over the last 10 year they have recruited 27 five-star players,
    more than the rest of the Big Ten combined",
    caption="Source: ON3 and Sports Reference | By Austin Tejral"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  )

title: About Me
text: Hello, My Name is Austin Tejral, and I am a junior at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. I am majoring in Sports Media and Communications, and looking to increase my sports data and analytics knowledge through this blog.

title: Austin Tejral’s Sport Data Blog
text:
Why Nebraska football’s biggest issue is developing talent.














Apr 12, 2024


Austin Tejral






No matching items
